Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the tax burden in Wisconsin by stating that it is "one of the highest-taxed states in the country" without providing sufficient evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the statement that Wisconsin is one of the highest-taxed states.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being one of the highest-taxed states is inherently negative, without considering other factors or the effectiveness of the tax system.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the tax rates in Wisconsin, such as the presence of government services or the distribution of tax burden across different income brackets.
